name: La Guillotiere

reviews.text: We can't speak highly enough about La Guillotiere and would concur with all of the positive reviews so far. Sean and Anne are great hosts, the breakfast is delicious, and the house itself and pool area are charming. We stayed for a week in June this year and also had a 1 yr old baby in tow so were looking for somewhere quite relaxed and child friendly. We made good use of the small kitchen and ate some of our evening meals by the pool, which was very enjoyable. We were certainly made to feel very welcome during our entire stay and nothing we asked for was ever too much trouble. If you're looking for top quality guest house, then this certainly ticks all the boxes. We cannot wait to return!
reviews.title: Fantastic place!

reviews.text: We had a great stay at La Guillotiere. The Estate is located in picturesque, woodsy countryside of Loire Valley in close proximity to Tours, Azay Le Rideau, Villandry, Amboise and Chenonceaux. The Manor gives a sense of settled comfort and the feeling there is both tranquil and welcoming. A big part of that is friendly, relaxed and attentive attitude of the hosts. Our room as well as bathroom were very spacious and charming with warm antique decor.The presentation of a breakfast fare was truly memorable; especially the display of French traditional pastries.
reviews.title: Tranquil and welcoming.

reviews.text: An Irish Welcome in the heart of France. This is a beautiful place to stay, large comfortable accommodation and a first class breakfast. I can't recommend this place highly enough and will be back!
reviews.title: Splendid

reviews.text: Our first B&B experience and I think it will be difficult to beat! Upon our arrival around 5 p.m., Anne and Sean greeted us and offered us a drink - very much appreciated after the 4-5 hour drive from Beaune. After we settled our things into the spacious room, we sat outside and enjoyed a glass of wine before we headed off to a restaurant for dinner. Sean recommended a restaurant and Anne called in our reservations. The breakfast Anne and Sean served in the morning was wonderful - pastries, juice, coffee, cheese, etc. It was nice to sit around the dining room table for breakfast with other guests - two families from Germany were staying there at the same time. Thank you Sean and Anne for a wonderful experience.
reviews.title: Wonderful... thanks Sean and Anne!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second stay at La Guillotiere, the first was 2 years ago en route to Southern France. Sean & Ann remembered us & made us very welcome. The location is very convenient for an en route stopover - just a few minutes from the motorway - and for exploring the Loire Valley, being pretty central to the main chateaux. But more than that, it's just a lovely place to stay.
reviews.title: A great place to stay

reviews.text: Highly recommend this chambre d'hotes. We were greeted with a very nice cup of tea. Rooms were spacious and comfortable and of a high standard. There was a guest kitchen available if you didn't feel like going out to dinner. The breakfast was amazing, we just had to take photos. It was very quiet and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The lovely old house had a country setting surrounded with large trees and farmland.
reviews.title: Fantastic place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I, along with another couple, spent two nights in May at La Guillotiere. Shawn and Anne could not have been more gracious hosts and the house and grounds are breathtakingly gorgeous! The history of this house alone is enough to keep me captivated for hours.
reviews.title: Absolutely amazing experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We'd just come from a few nights in Paris, where we found things to be a little stuffy, but the atmosphere at La Guillotiere was anything but. Really, you two, don't change a thing!
reviews.title: What a relaxing place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just finished a ten day trip to France with our last night in La Guillotiere. We did a lot of driving during the ten day trip and this was the most peaceful location you could ask for. Just outside the village of Esvres and set in a beautifully wooded location, La Guillotiere is a perfect stop for a few days. The hosts, Anne and Sean, made our visit a delight. Our room, The Oscar Wilde, was really nice with windows on three walls and views over the whole countryside. Really nice bed (after several very hard mattresses) meant a sound sleep and when we woke the only sounds were of the birds singing. A gorgeous breakfast of fresh juice, croissants, breads, yoghurts etc finished a perfect stay.
reviews.title: Perfect ending to our trip to France

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I cannot say enough about La Guillotiere and our lovely hosts, an Irish couple named Anne and Sean. From the moment we turned into their long, tree-lined lane, we knew this would be a peaceful, relaxing haven and the perfect end to our ten-day trip to France.
reviews.title: a great experience!

reviews.text: How could we return to France from the other side of the world ( New Zealand ) without returning here.
reviews.title: Out of this World - Simply the Best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I were lucky enough to stumble upon Anne and Sean's gorgeous home, during our first trip to France in 2007.
reviews.title: Lovely B&B in a beautiful location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we decided to return in July this year with our two daughters, how could we come all this way, with out returning to La Guillotiere.
reviews.title: Tranquil Rural Idyll

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bedrooms are absolutely superb and Anne's breakfasts are to die for - Sean is pretty good at the dishes too !!!!!.
reviews.title: Will defintely go back!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hopefully we will return one day again soon - we could not visit France without returning here.
reviews.title: Heavenly hideaway

likes.liked: — The welcome, the food, the rooms, the scenery
likes.disliked: — Getting worn out playing fetch with the dog! :)

reviews.title: A wonderful place to stay
reviews.text: I was there with my family and we had a beautiful experience. The residence is beautiful and Anne was really very nice. She gave us all the information we needed to travel around as well as very appreciated suggestions on the restaurants nearby. Breakfast was delicious and served in a very nice dining room, it made you feel very relaxed and ready to start the day. We stayed in the suite (two separated rooms, one with full bathroom, the other one with shower and basin)

La Guillotiere is without a doubt the most beautiful B&B I have ever stayed in. The rooms are big, light, airy, spotlessly clean and beautifully decorated. The breakfast is amazing and the location idyllic. Anne and Sean are the perfect hosts, giving selflessly of their time and their extensive knowledge of the area. Thanks for an amazing holiday :)
reviews.title: the beauty of the french countryside

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a very enjoyable stay at Sean and Ann's home and it was so good that our intended 5 night stay ended up as 7 nights. The house and our room were lovely and the guest kitchen was an added bonus, very useful to be able to prepare a meal if you didn't wish to go out to dine. Having a meal in the evening while overlooking the pool as the sun went down just added to the pleasure. The breakfasts were very good with as much as you could eat of good quality food which varied each day. It has to the best B&B I have ever stayed at, and I hope to return to again.
reviews.title: A wonderful place to stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Mike
reviews.title: Dream House, dream location, wonderful hosts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We only stayed one night at La Guillotiere, but it was wonderful! Being someone who travels a lot accross Europe and the Middle East on Business trips, I am easily disappointed, but this chambre d'hote ticked all the boxes. We greatly appreciated, the lovely warm welcome, the complementary welcome drink served to us by the pool, the sumptuous feast of a breakfast complete with fresh fruit, pastries, breads, home-made scones & jam (I LOVED Anne's lemon curd), our beautiful room & the gorgous bed linnen, the marvellous views and tranquility of this beautiful residence. A BIG thank you also to Anne for coming to the rescue with Frizz Eaze Dream Curls, when I found out that I left my precious curl cream at home. She even insisted I take the bottle with me. Outstanding kindness and generosity on top of everying else!! Kim & Robin (Irish/Belgian guests)
reviews.title: Countryside paradise with irish touch:)
